label: Dataset Version
description:
A number indicating the IATI specification version in use.
This is mandatory and must be a valid version.

label: Dataset Generated Datetime
description:
A date/time stamp for when this file was generated. This
is not necessarily the last-updated date for the
individual activity records in it. Use of this attribute
is highly recommended, to allow recipients to know when a
file has been updated.

label: Dataset Linked Data Default
description:
If a publisher chooses to publish linked data about their
IATI activities then allowing them to declare where this
data is published would support discovery of it, and any
additional information they may choose to publish as
Linked Data alongside it.

This attribute is a URI path upon which an activity
identifier can be appended to get a differentiable URI
for any activity contained within a file.

Where a publisher declares using one of these properties
that authoritative linked data is accessible for an
activity then consuming applications that are generating
Linked Data from an IATI XML file should assert an
owl:sameAs relationship to the relevant URI.

label: Last Updated Datetime
description:
The last date/time that the data for this specific
activity was updated.  This date must change whenever the
value of any field changes.

label: Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the default language of text in this activity. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If this is not declared then the xml:lang attribute MUST be specified for each narrative element.

label: Default Currency
description:
Default ISO 4217 alphabetic currency code for all
financial values in this activity report. If this is not
declared then the currency attribute MUST be specified for
all monetary values.

label: Humanitarian
description:
A process flag to indicate that this activity relates entirely
or partially to humanitarian aid.

label: Hierarchy
description:
The hierarchical level within the reporting organisation's
subdivision of its units of aid. (eg activity = 1;
sub-activity = 2; sub-sub-activity = 3). If hierarchy is
not reported then 1 is assumed. If multiple levels are
reported then, to avoid double counting, financial
transactions should only be reported at the lowest
hierarchical level.

label: Linked Data Uri
description:
A Linked Data URI for a given activity (overrides
iati-activities/\@linked-data-default if set)

label: Budget Not Provided
description: A code indicating the reason why this activity does not contain any iati-activity/budget elements. The attribute MUST only be used when no budget elements are present.

label: Iati Identifier
description:
A globally unique identifier for the activity.

This MUST be prefixed with EITHER the current IATI
organisation identifier for the reporting organisation
(reporting-org/\@ref) OR a previous identifier reported in
other-identifier, and suffixed with the organisation’s own
activity identifier. The prefix and the suffix should be
separated by a hyphen "-".

Once an activity has been reported to IATI its identifier MUST
NOT be changed in subsequent updates.
name: iati-identifier

label: Reporting Org Ref
description: Machine-readable identification string for the organisation issuing the report. Must be in the format {RegistrationAgency}-{RegistrationNumber} where {RegistrationAgency} is a valid code in the Organisation Registration Agency code list and {RegistrationNumber} is a valid identifier issued by the {RegistrationAgency}.

label: Reporting Org Type
description: The type of organisation issuing the report. See IATI codelist for values.

label: Reporting Org Secondary Reporter
description: A flag indicating that the reporting organisation of this activity is acting as a secondary reporter. A secondary reporter is one that reproduces data on the activities of an organisation for which it is not directly responsible. This does not include a publisher officially assigned as a proxy to report on behalf of another.

label: Reporting Org Narrative
description:
The name of the organisation. May be repeated for
different languages.
name: narrative

label: Reporting Org Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Title Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Title Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Description Type
description:
The type of description being provided. This is not
required if only one general description of the activity
is reported.

label: Description Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Description Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Participating Org Ref
description: Machine-readable identification string for the organisation issuing the report. Must be in the format {RegistrationAgency}-{RegistrationNumber} where {RegistrationAgency} is a valid code in the Organisation Registration Agency code list and {RegistrationNumber} is a valid identifier issued by the {RegistrationAgency}. If this is not present then the narrative MUST contain the name of the organisation.

label: Participating Org Type
description: The type of organisation issuing the report. See IATI codelist for values.

label: Participating Org Role
description: An IATI code describing the organisation's role in the activity (donor, agency, etc.).

label: Participating Org Activity Id
description: A valid activity identifier published by the participating organisation which points to the activity that it has published to IATI that describes its role in this activity.

label: Participating Org Crs Channel Code
description: Under CRS++ Reporting Directives this code identifies the implementing agency. Codes ending in '00' are generic and are similar to the OrganisationType code.

label: Participating Org Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Participating Org Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Other Identifier Ref
description:
The identifier you wish to report.
This can be used to report a number of different types
of identifiers. See the OtherIdentifierType codelist
for details and options.

label: Other Identifier Type
description:
The type of identifier being reported, taken from
the OtherIdentifierType codelist.

label: Other Identifier Owner Org Ref
description:
An organisation identifier. This is NOT MANDATORY
but when used MUST contain a valid organisation
identifier.

label: Other Identifier Owner Org Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Other Identifier Owner Org Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Activity Status Code
description: An IATI code defining the current status of the activity.

label: Activity Date Type
description: An IATI code defining the type of activity date being reported.

label: Activity Date Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Activity Date Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Contact Info Type
description: The type of contact. See IATI codelist for values.

label: Contact Info Organisation Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Contact Info Organisation Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Contact Info Department Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Contact Info Department Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Contact Info Person Name Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Contact Info Person Name Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Contact Info Job Title Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Contact Info Job Title Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Contact Info Telephone
description:
The contact telephone number. May be repeated for
multiple numbers.
name: telephone

label: Contact Info Email
description:
The contact email address. May be repeated for multiple
addresses.
name: email

label: Contact Info Website
description: The contact web address. May be repeated for multiple sites.
name: website

label: Contact Info Mailing Address Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Contact Info Mailing Address Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Activity Scope Code
description: The geographical scope. See IATI codelist for values.

label: Recipient Country Code
description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code for the country.

label: Recipient Country Percentage
description: The percentage of total commitments or total activity budget to this item. Content must be a decimal number between 0 and 100 inclusive, with no percentage sign. Percentages for all reported countries and regions within a vocabulary MUST add up to 100.

label: Recipient Country Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Recipient Country Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Recipient Region Code
description:
Either an OECD DAC or UN region code. Codelist is
determined by vocabulary attribute.

label: Recipient Region Vocabulary
description:
An IATI code for the vocabulary from which the region code
is drawn. If it is not present 1 - 'OECD DAC' is assumed.

label: Recipient Region Vocabulary Uri
description: The URI where this vocabulary is defined. If the vocabulary is 99 (reporting organisation), the URI where this internal vocabulary is defined. While this is an optional field it is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED that all publishers use it to ensure that the meaning of their codes are fully understood by data users.

label: Recipient Region Percentage
description: The percentage of total commitments or total activity budget to this item. Content must be a decimal number between 0 and 100 inclusive, with no percentage sign. Percentages for all reported countries and regions within a vocabulary MUST add up to 100.

label: Recipient Region Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Recipient Region Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Location Ref
description: An internal reference that describes the location in the reporting organisation’s own system.

label: Location Location Reach Code
description: An IATI code for the geographic scope of the activity.

label: Location Location Id Code
description: A code from the gazetteer or administrative boundary repository specified by the vocabulary

label: Location Location Id Vocabulary
description: An IATI code for a recognised gazetteer or administrative boundary repository.

label: Location Name Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Location Name Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Location Description Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Location Description Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Location Activity Description Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Location Activity Description Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Location Administrative Code
description: The code for the administrative area being reported from the vocabulary specified.

label: Location Administrative Vocabulary
description: An IATI code for a recognised administrative boundary repository.

label: Location Administrative Level
description: A number defining a subdivision within a hierarchical system of administrative areas. The precise system for defining the particular meaning of each @level value is determined by the @vocabulary being used.

label: Location Point Srsname
description:
The name of the spatial reference system used by the coordinates.

Always: http://www.opengis.net/def/crs/EPSG/0/4326

label: Location Point Pos
description: The latitude and longitude coordinates in the format "lat lng"
name: pos

label: Location Exactness Code
description: A code from the Geographic Exactness Codelist.

label: Location Location Class Code
description: A code from the Location Class codelist

label: Location Feature Designation Code
description: A feature designation code form the authorised list (maintained by the US National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency)

label: Sector Vocabulary
description:
An IATI code for the vocabulary (see codelist) used for sector classifications. If omitted, OECD DAC 5-digit Purpose Codes are assumed.

It is recommended that OECD DAC 5-digit Purpose Codes are used wherever possible. It is also recommended that if a publisher has its own classification system or systems then the vocabularies 99 or 98 (Reporting Organisation's own vocabularies) should be used in addition to DAC codes.

Publishers using 98 or 99 must also include a narrative in the narrative element.

Note that if multiple sector codes are used in multiple vocabularies, then each vocabulary’s percentages should add up to 100.

Sector can also be reported at the transaction level rather than the activity level. Sector must only be reported at EITHER transaction level OR activity level.

label: Sector Vocabulary Uri
description: The URI where this vocabulary is defined. If the vocabulary is 99 or 98 (reporting organisation), the URI where this internal vocabulary is defined. While this is an optional field it is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED that all publishers use it to ensure that the meaning of their codes are fully understood by data users.

label: Sector Code
description: The code for the sector.

label: Sector Percentage
description: The percentage of total commitments or total activity budget to this item. Content must be a decimal number between 0 and 100 inclusive, with no percentage sign. All reported sectors from the same vocabulary MUST add up to 100.

label: Sector Narrative
description:
The description of a sector defined by the reporting
organisation. (Only to be used when the reporting
organisation's own vocabulary is being used).
name: narrative

label: Sector Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Tag Code
description: The code for the tag as defined in the specified vocabulary.

label: Tag Vocabulary
description: An IATI code for the vocabulary or taxonomy (see non-embedded codelist) used for tag classifications.

label: Tag Vocabulary Uri
description: The URI where this vocabulary is defined.

label: Tag Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Tag Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Country Budget Items Vocabulary
description: An IATI code for the common functional classification or country system (This allows for common codes, country-specific, or any other classification agreed between countries and donors).

label: Country Budget Items Budget Item Code
description: A code for the budget-item from the vocabulary specified.

label: Country Budget Items Budget Item Percentage
description: When multiple budget-item elements are declared within a single country-budget-items element, then, for each vocabulary used, the percentage values should sum 100%.

label: Country Budget Items Budget Item Description Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Country Budget Items Budget Item Description Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Humanitarian Scope Type
description: A code for the type of event or action being classified.

label: Humanitarian Scope Vocabulary
description:
A code for a recognised vocabulary of terms classifying the
event or action.

label: Humanitarian Scope Vocabulary Uri
description:
A u.r.i. for the vocabulary specified which provides access to
the list of codes and descriptions.

label: Humanitarian Scope Code
description: A code for the event or action from the vocabulary specified.

label: Humanitarian Scope Narrative
description: The description of the code specified.
name: narrative

label: Humanitarian Scope Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Policy Marker Vocabulary
description:
An IATI code for the vocabulary to be used to define
policy markers. If omitted then the OECD DAC vocabulary is
assumed.

label: Policy Marker Vocabulary Uri
description:
If the vocabulary is 99 (reporting organisation), the URI
where this internal vocabulary is defined.

label: Policy Marker Code
description:
A policy marker code from the codelist specified in the
vocabulary.

label: Policy Marker Significance
description:
An OECD DAC CRS code indicating the significance of the policy marker
for this activity. This attribute MUST be used for all OECD DAC CRS
vocabularies.

label: Policy Marker Narrative
description:
A description of the policy marker. This MUST ONLY be
used if vocabulary is 99 (the reporting
organisation's own marker vocabulary). May be repeated
for multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Policy Marker Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Collaboration Type Code
description: A code from the OECD DAC CRS "Bi_Multi" codelist.

label: Default Flow Type Code
description: A code from the OECD DAC CRS "Type of flow" codelist

label: Default Finance Type Code
description: A code from the OECD DAC CRS "Type of finance" codelist

label: Default Aid Type Code
description: A code from the specified vocabulary.

label: Default Aid Type Vocabulary
description:
A code for the vocabulary aid-type classifications. If omitted the AidType (OECD DAC) codelist is assumed. The code must be a valid value in the AidTypeVocabulary codelist.

Each selected vocabulary should only be used once for each activity (iati-activity/default-aid-type) or transaction (iati-activity/transaction/aid-type). All activities and/or transactions should contain a code from the DAC Type of Aid Vocabulary. The above guidelines should be converted to rules at the next integer upgrade.

label: Default Tied Status Code
description:
An IATI code interpreting the usage of Columns 36-38 of the
CRS++ reporting format. (Amount tied, Amount partially
untied, Amount tied)

label: Budget Type
description: Whether this is the original budget (prepared when the original commitment was made) or has subsequently been revised

label: Budget Status
description: The status explains whether the budget being reported is indicative or has been formally committed. The value should appear within the BudgetStatus codelist. If the @status attribute is not present, the budget is assumed to be indicative.

label: Budget Value
description: The budget for this period.
name: value

label: Budget Value Currency
description:
A three letter ISO 4217 code for the original currency of the
amount. This is required for all currency amounts unless
the iati-organisation/\@default-currency attribute is
specified.

label: Budget Value Value Date
description:
The date to be used for determining the exchange rate for
currency conversions.

label: Planned Disbursement Type
description: Whether this is an original plan (prepared when the original commitment was made) or has subsequently been revised.

label: Planned Disbursement Period Start Iso Date
Planned Disbursement Period End Iso Date
Planned Disbursement Value
description: The amount that is planned to be disbursed in the specified currency.
name: value

label: Planned Disbursement Value Currency
description:
A three letter ISO 4217 code for the original currency of the
amount. This is required for all currency amounts unless
the iati-organisation/\@default-currency attribute is
specified.

label: Planned Disbursement Value Value Date
description:
The date to be used for determining the exchange rate for
currency conversions.

label: Planned Disbursement Provider Org Ref
description: Machine-readable identification string for the organisation issuing the report. Must be in the format {RegistrationAgency}-{RegistrationNumber} where {RegistrationAgency} is a valid code in the Organisation Registration Agency code list and {RegistrationNumber} is a valid identifier issued by the {RegistrationAgency}. If this is not present then the narrative MUST contain the name of the organisation.

label: Planned Disbursement Provider Org Provider Activity Id
description: The identifier for the activity in which the planned disbursement will be reported. If omitted the current activity is assumed.

label: Planned Disbursement Provider Org Type
description: The type of organisation providing the funds.

label: Planned Disbursement Provider Org Narrative
description: The name of the organisation. This can be repeated in multiple languages
name: narrative

label: Planned Disbursement Provider Org Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Planned Disbursement Receiver Org Ref
description: Machine-readable identification string for the organisation issuing the report. Must be in the format {RegistrationAgency}-{RegistrationNumber} where {RegistrationAgency} is a valid code in the Organisation Registration Agency code list and {RegistrationNumber} is a valid identifier issued by the {RegistrationAgency}. If this is not present then the narrative MUST contain the name of the organisation.

label: Planned Disbursement Receiver Org Receiver Activity Id
description: If outgoing funds are being provided to another activity that is reported to IATI, this may, if possible, record the unique IATI activity identifier for that activity.

label: Planned Disbursement Receiver Org Type
description: The type of organisation receiving the funds.

label: Planned Disbursement Receiver Org Narrative
description: The name of the organisation. This can be repeated in multiple languages
name: narrative

label: Planned Disbursement Receiver Org Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Capital Spend Percentage
description: The percentage of the total commitment allocated to or planned for capital expenditure. Content must be a decimal number between 0 and 100 inclusive, with no percentage sign.

label: Transaction Ref
description: An internal reference linking this transaction back to the publisher's financial management system.

label: Transaction Humanitarian
description: A process flag to indicate that this transaction relates entirely or partially to humanitarian aid. If the entire activity relates to humanitarian aid this should be reported using iati-activity/\@humanitarian, rather than for each transaction.

label: Transaction Transaction Type Code
description: A code from the specified vocabulary.

label: Transaction Value
description: The amount of the contribution.
name: value

label: Transaction Value Currency
description:
A three letter ISO 4217 code for the original currency of the
amount. This is required for all currency amounts unless
the iati-organisation/\@default-currency attribute is
specified.

label: Transaction Value Value Date
description:
The date to be used for determining the exchange rate for
currency conversions.

label: Transaction Description Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Transaction Description Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Transaction Provider Org Ref
description: Machine-readable identification string for the organisation issuing the report. Must be in the format {RegistrationAgency}-{RegistrationNumber} where {RegistrationAgency} is a valid code in the Organisation Registration Agency code list and {RegistrationNumber} is a valid identifier issued by the {RegistrationAgency}. If this is not present then the narrative MUST contain the name of the organisation.

label: Transaction Provider Org Provider Activity Id
description:
If incoming funds are being provided from the budget
of another activity that is reported to IATI, it if
STRONGLY RECOMMENDED that this should record the
provider's unique IATI activity identifier for that
activity.

label: Transaction Provider Org Type
description: The type of organisation providing the funds.

label: Transaction Provider Org Narrative
description:
The name of the organisation. This can be repeated
in multiple languages
name: narrative

label: Transaction Provider Org Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Transaction Receiver Org Ref
description: Machine-readable identification string for the organisation issuing the report. Must be in the format {RegistrationAgency}-{RegistrationNumber} where {RegistrationAgency} is a valid code in the Organisation Registration Agency code list and {RegistrationNumber} is a valid identifier issued by the {RegistrationAgency}. If this is not present then the narrative MUST contain the name of the organisation.

label: Transaction Receiver Org Receiver Activity Id
description: If outgoing funds are being provided to another activity that is reported to IATI, this may, if possible, record the unique IATI activity identifier for that activity.

label: Transaction Receiver Org Type
description: The type of organisation receiving the funds.

label: Transaction Receiver Org Narrative
description: The name of the organisation. This can be repeated in multiple languages
name: narrative

label: Transaction Receiver Org Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Transaction Disbursement Channel Code
description: An IATI code defining channels of disbursement

label: Transaction Sector Vocabulary
description:
An IATI code for the vocabulary (codelist) used for sector classifications. If omitted, OECD DAC 5-digit Purpose Codes are assumed.

It is recommended that OECD DAC 5-digit Purpose Codes are used wherever possible. It is also recommended that if a publisher has its own classification system or systems, then the vocabularies 99 or 98 (Reporting Organisation's own vocabularies) should be used in addition to the DAC codes.

Note that at transaction level, only one sector per vocabulary can be reported.

label: Transaction Sector Vocabulary Uri
description: The URI where this vocabulary is defined. If the vocabulary is 99 or 98 (reporting organisation), the URI where this internal vocabulary is defined. While this is an optional field it is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED that all publishers use it to ensure that the meaning of their codes are fully understood by data users.

label: Transaction Sector Code
description: The code for the sector.

label: Transaction Sector Narrative
description: The free text description of the reporting organisation's own sector definition. This can be repeated in multiple languages
name: narrative

label: Transaction Sector Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Transaction Recipient Country Code
description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code for the country.

label: Transaction Recipient Country Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Transaction Recipient Country Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Transaction Recipient Region Code
description: Either an OECD DAC or UN region code. Codelist is determined by vocabulary attribute.

label: Transaction Recipient Region Vocabulary
description: An IATI code for the vocabulary from which the region code is drawn. If it is not present 1 - 'OECD DAC' is assumed.

label: Transaction Recipient Region Vocabulary Uri
description: The URI where this vocabulary is defined. If the vocabulary is 99 (reporting organisation), the URI where this internal vocabulary is defined. While this is an optional field it is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED that all publishers use it to ensure that the meaning of their codes are fully understood by data users.

label: Transaction Recipient Region Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Transaction Recipient Region Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Transaction Flow Type Code
description: A code from the OECD DAC CRS "Type of flow" codelist

label: Transaction Finance Type Code
description: A code from the OECD DAC CRS "Type of finance" codelist

label: Transaction Aid Type Code
description: A code from the specified vocabulary.

label: Transaction Aid Type Vocabulary
description:
A code for the vocabulary aid-type classifications. If omitted the AidType (OECD DAC) codelist is assumed. The code must be a valid value in the AidTypeVocabulary codelist.

Each selected vocabulary should only be used once for each activity (iati-activity/default-aid-type) or transaction (iati-activity/transaction/aid-type). All activities and/or transactions should contain a code from the DAC Type of Aid Vocabulary. The above guidelines should be converted to rules at the next integer upgrade.

label: Transaction Tied Status Code
description: An IATI code interpreting the usage of Columns 36-38 of the CRS++ reporting format. (Amount tied, Amount partially untied, Amount tied)

label: Document Link Url
description: The target URL of the external document, e.g. "http://www.example.org/doc.odt".

label: Document Link Format
description: An IANA code for the MIME type of the document being referenced, e.g. "application/pdf".

label: Document Link Title Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Document Link Title Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Document Link Description Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Document Link Description Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Document Link Category Code
description: An IATI code defining the category of the document.

label: Document Link Language Code
description: ISO 639-1 language code

label: Document Link Document Date Iso Date
Related Activity Ref
description: A valid activity identifier (as defined in iati-activity/iati-identifier).

label: Related Activity Type
description: An IATI code for the type of relationship

label: Legacy Data Name
description: The original field name in the reporting organisation's system

label: Legacy Data Value
description: The original field value in the reporting organisation's system

label: Legacy Data Iati Equivalent
description: The name of the equivalent IATI element.

label: Conditions Attached
description: A yes/no (1/0) value stating whether there are conditions attached to the activity. It is strongly recommended that this attribute is reported, even if there are no conditions attached (i.e. attached="0")

label: Conditions Condition Type
description: An IATI code defining the type of condition.

label: Conditions Condition Narrative
description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

label: Conditions Condition Narrative Xml Lang
description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

label: Result Type
description: An IATI code for the type of result being reported.

label: Result Aggregation Status
description: Boolean flag indicating whether the data in the result set are suitable for aggregation.

description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.

Result Reference Code
description: A code from the codelist identified in vocabulary that identifies a results framework.

label: Result Reference Vocabulary
description: A code for the results framework vocabulary. The code must be a valid value in the ResultVocabulary codelist.

label: Result Reference Vocabulary Uri
description: The URI where this vocabulary is defined. If the vocabulary is 99 (reporting organisation), the URI where this internal vocabulary is defined. While this is an optional field it is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED that all publishers use it to ensure that the meaning of their codes are fully understood by data users.

label: Result Indicator Measure
description: An IATI code defining the unit of measure in which the value is reported.

label: Result Indicator Ascending
description:
A boolean describing the behaviour of the indicator.
It is "true" if the indicator improves from small to large (e.g. clinics built); false if it improves from large to small (e.g. cases of a disease).

label: Result Indicator Aggregation Status
description: Boolean flag indicating whether the data in the result set are suitable for aggregation.

description:
The free text name or description of the item being described. This can
be repeated in multiple languages.
name: narrative

description: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed.

Result Indicator Reference Vocabulary
description: A code for a recognised vocabulary of indicators. The value for this field should appear in the IndicatorVocabulary codelist.

label: Result Indicator Reference Code
description: A code for an indicator defined in the specified vocabulary specified.

label: Result Indicator Reference Indicator Uri
description: The URI where this vocabulary is defined. If the vocabulary is 99 (reporting organisation), the URI where this internal vocabulary is defined. While this is an optional field it is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED that all publishers use it to ensure that the meaning of their codes are fully understood by data users.

label: Result Indicator Baseline Year
description: The year the baseline value was taken (yyyy)

label: Result Indicator Baseline Value
description:
The baseline value.

The @value should be omitted for qualitative measures.

The @value must be included for non-qualitative measures.

The @value should be a valid number for all non-qualitative measures.

label: Result Indicator Baseline Location Ref
description: A cross-reference to the internal reference assigned to a defined location: iati-activity/location/\@ref.

label: Result Indicator Baseline Dimension Name
description: Freetext description of a category being disaggregated.

label: Result Indicator Baseline Dimension Value
description: Description of the value being disaggregated.

label: Result Indicator Baseline Document Link Url
description: The target URL of the external document, e.g. "http://www.example.org/doc.odt".

description: An IANA code for the MIME type of the document being referenced, e.g. "application/pdf".

Crs Add Other Flags Code
description: An IATI code describing the equivalent CRS++ columns

label: Crs Add Other Flags Significance
description: A boolean indicating whether the flag applies. If 'false' do not report the flag

label: Crs Add Loan Terms Rate 1
description:
Interest Rate. If an ODA loan with variable interest rate, report the variable rate here and the reference fixed rate as rate-2

Enter the rate without the percentage sign.

label: Crs Add Loan Terms Rate 2
description:
Second Interest Rate.  If an ODA loan with variable interest rate, report the variable rate as rate-1 and the reference fixed rate here

Enter the rate without the percentage sign.

label: Crs Add Loan Terms Repayment Type Code
description: An IATI codelist tabulating CRS-specified values for the type of Repayment.

label: Crs Add Loan Terms Repayment Plan Code
description: An IATI codelist tabulating CRS-specified values for the number of repayments per annum.

label: Crs Add Loan Terms Commitment Date Iso Date
Crs Add Loan Terms Repayment First Date Iso Date
Crs Add Loan Terms Repayment Final Date Iso Date
Crs Add Loan Status Year
description: CRS Reporting Year (CRS++ Column 1)

label: Crs Add Loan Status Currency
description:
A three letter ISO 4217 code for the original currency of the
amount. This is required for all currency amounts unless
the iati-organisation/\@default-currency attribute is
specified.

label: Crs Add Loan Status Value Date
description:
The date to be used for determining the exchange rate for
currency conversions.

label: Crs Add Loan Status Interest Received
description: Interest received during the reporting year
name: interest-received

label: Crs Add Loan Status Principal Outstanding
description: The amount of principal owed on the loan at the end of the reporting year.
name: principal-outstanding

label: Crs Add Loan Status Principal Arrears
description: Arrears of principal at the end of the year. Included in principal-outstanding
name: principal-arrears

label: Crs Add Loan Status Interest Arrears
description: Arrears of interest at the end of the year
name: interest-arrears

label: Crs Add Channel Code
description: The CRS channel code for this activity. This should only be used for reporting to CRS. The code list contains both organisation types and names of organisations. For non-CRS purposes these should be reported using the participating-org element.
name: channel-code

label: Fss Extraction Date
description: The exact date when the information was collected or extracted from donors' aid management systems.

label: Fss Priority
description: True if the partner country is a priority partner country.

label: Fss Phaseout Year
description: If there are plans to phase out operations from the partner country, this column shows the projected year of last disbursements.

label: Fss Forecast
description: A container to hold separate forecasts for each of the years specified Text() holds the forecast value for each year.
name: forecast

label: Fss Forecast Year
description: The calendar year that the forward spend covers

label: Fss Forecast Currency
description:
A three letter ISO 4217 code for the original currency of the
amount. This is required for all currency amounts unless
the iati-organisation/\@default-currency attribute is
specified.

label: Fss Forecast Value Date
description:
The date to be used for determining the exchange rate for
currency conversions.
